title: Morgan Stanley ready to drive $1b-plus VicRoads privatisation
text:
Morgan Stanley’s investment banking team is in pole position to oversee Victoria’s next privatisation.

Street Talk understands Victorian Treasurer Tim Pallas’ team is in the market for an investment bank to help consider and oversee a sale of part of the state’s motor registry unit, and has taken face-to-face pitches in the past month.

Morgan Stanley is well-placed to help the state consider ways to privatise part of the motor registry unit VicRoads. AFR

Morgan Stanley is understood to have emerged as the most likely to be appointed and an announcement is expected in the short term.

The Wall Street giant's local team is no stranger to Victorian privatisations. The bank did the heavy lifting when Victoria secured $9.7 billion for the Port of Melbourne in 2016, in what was a keenly contested auction between two heavyweight consortiums.

This time, it’ll be asked to help structure the best way to carve up and privatise part of the motor registry unit VicRoads. The state is believed to be considering privatising VicRoads’ registration and licensing function, in the same way it sold part of its land registry last year.
description: Morgan Stanley’s investment banking team is in pole position to oversee Victoria’s next privatisation.
